div.p: Since news was first reported in December about the outbreak of the COVID-19 virus (a.k.a., coronavirus) in Wuhan, China, the virus has spread to parts of the United States. Understandably, many people have concerns about guarding against infection, as well as preparing for the possibility of the virus spreading to our community. In an effort to meet these concerns, the Paterson Public School District has constructed this webpage. The district will update this page as new information on COVID-19 becomes available.

• All after school activities are cancelled as of Monday, March 16th. This includes programs held on site, on school grounds, and all programs at locations off site, away from schools grounds.

• All staff, students and administrators should report to school on Monday, March 16th, for a regular school day. At the end of school day, packets for home instruction will be distributed for students to use while the district is closed from Tuesday, March 17th through Tuesday, March 31st. Schools will reopen on Wednesday, April 1st. Students MUST pick up their instructional packets and turn them in on April 1st in order to get credit and to receive a grade for the days schools are closed.
For any students who cannot pick up their home instruction packets on Monday, administrators will be at schools on Tuesday, March 17th and will have packets available for students.
Food distribution will begin on Tuesday, March 17th.
Breakfast and lunch will be provided from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. There will be two food distribution sites in each of the City of Paterson’s six wards. The locations will be posted on the district’s website the district’s Facebook page, Instagram account and Twitter account. Students and parents should go to the distribution location closest to their residence.
The food distribution locations are:

div.h3: On Monday, April 20th the district will resume distributing student meals, keeping with the twice-a-week distribution schedule on Mondays and Wednesdays until further notice.
The next round of student home instruction packets will be distributed on Tuesday, April 21st and Wednesday, April 22nd from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.

div.h2: Chromebook Distribution to District High School Students
div.h3:
Beginning Monday, April 20th, Chromebooks will be distributed to all district high school students.
Parents and guardians, as well as the students, will need to sign a loan agreement in order for a Chromebook to be loaned to the student. Students should report to the high school they attend to obtain a Chromebook on the designated dates in the chart below.
All high schools will distribute Chromebooks from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. and from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m.
Completed student instruction packets are due on the day schools reopen. Students MUST turn in their completed packets in order to receive credit and grades for the days schools are closed.
